Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Water-soaked spots on leaves, turning brown and necrotic. Lesions may have a yellow halo.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.causes: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides or bactericides. Remove and destroy infected plants.

Pepper__bell___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.

Potato___Early_blight.symptoms: Circular, dark lesions on lower leaves, often surrounded by yellowing. Lesions may have a target-like appearance.
Potato___Early_blight.causes: Caused by the fungus Alternaria solani.
Potato___Early_blight.treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper.

Potato___Late_blight.symptoms: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves, often turning brown and necrotic. White, fluffy growth may appear on the underside of leaves in humid conditions.
Potato___Late_blight.causes: Caused by the oomycete Phytophthora infestans.
Potato___Late_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing copper or mancozeb. Remove and destroy infected plant debris.

Potato___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves, often with a yellow halo. Lesions may coalesce and cause defoliation.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.causes: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides or bactericides. Remove and destroy infected plants.

Tomato_Early_blight.symptoms: Circular, dark lesions on lower leaves, often surrounded by yellowing. Lesions may have a target-like appearance.
Tomato_Early_blight.causes: Caused by the fungus Alternaria solani.
Tomato_Early_blight.treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper.

Tomato_Late_blight.symptoms: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves, often turning brown and necrotic. White, fluffy growth may appear on the underside of leaves in humid conditions.
Tomato_Late_blight.causes: Caused by the oomycete Phytophthora infestans.
Tomato_Late_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing copper or mancozeb. Remove and destroy infected plant debris.

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellowing and mottling of leaves, often with fuzzy, white growth on the underside of leaves.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.causes: Caused by the fungus Fulvia fulva (formerly Cladosporium fulvum).
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.treatment: Improve air circulation. Apply fungicides containing copper or chlorothalonil.

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Dark, circular lesions with white or gray centers on leaves. Lesions may coalesce and cause defoliation.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.causes: Caused by the fungus Septoria lycopersici.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing copper or chlorothalonil.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.symptoms: Yellowing or stippling of leaves, often with webbing on the underside of leaves.
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.causes: Caused by the spider mite Tetranychus urticae.
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.treatment: Spray with insecticidal soap or neem oil. Introduce natural predators such as predatory mites.

Tomato__Target_Spot.symptoms: Circular lesions with concentric rings on leaves, often surrounded by yellowing.
Tomato__Target_Spot.causes: Caused by the fungus Corynespora cassiicola.
Tomato__Target_Spot.treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing copper or chlorothalonil.

Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.symptoms: Yellowing and curling of leaves, often with stunted growth and reduced fruit yield.
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.causes: Caused by the Tomato yellow leaf curl virus (TYLCV).
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.treatment: Control whiteflies, which spread the virus. Plant resistant varieties.

Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mottled or mosaic pattern on leaves, often with stunted growth and reduced fruit yield.
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.causes: Caused by the Tomato mosaic virus (ToMV).
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.treatment: No cure available. Remove and destroy infected plants. Control aphids, which spread the virus.

Tomato_healty.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.

Raspberry___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.

Soybean___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.symptoms: White powdery spots on leaves, often with distorted growth.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.causes: Caused by the fungus Podosphaera xanthii.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.treatment: Apply fungicides containing sulfur or potassium bicarbonate. Improve air circulation.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.symptoms: Brown or scorched areas on leaf margins, often with browning of leaf tips.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.causes: Caused by various environmental stress factors, such as drought or excessive heat.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.treatment: Ensure adequate watering. Provide shade during hot periods.

Strawberry___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.

Apple___Apple_scab.symptoms: Dark, scabby lesions on leaves, often with corky texture. Lesions may also appear on fruit.
Apple___Apple_scab.causes: Caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis.
Apple___Apple_scab.treatment: Apply fungicides containing sulfur or copper. Remove and destroy infected leaves.

Apple___Black_rot.symptoms: Circular, black lesions on leaves, often with concentric rings. Lesions may also appear on fruit.
Apple___Black_rot.causes: Caused by the fungus Botryosphaeria obtusa.
Apple___Black_rot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or captan. Prune infected branches.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.symptoms: Yellow-orange spots or lesions on leaves, often with a raised texture. Lesions may produce spores.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.causes: Caused by the fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.treatment: Apply fungicides containing myclobutanil or tebuconazole. Remove nearby juniper hosts.

Apple___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.

Blueberry___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.symptoms: White powdery spots on leaves, often with distorted growth.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.causes: Caused by the fungus Podosphaera clandestina.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.treatment: Apply fungicides containing sulfur or potassium bicarbonate. Improve air circulation.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.symptoms: Grayish lesions with dark margins on leaves. Lesions may coalesce and cause extensive damage.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.causes: Caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.treatment: Rotate crops. Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.symptoms: Orange to brown pustules on leaves, often with raised texture. Pustules may produce spores.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.causes: Caused by the fungus Puccinia sorghi.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.treatment: Rotate crops. Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.symptoms: Long, elliptical lesions with tan centers on leaves. Lesions may coalesce and cause extensive damage.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.causes: Caused by the fungus Setosphaeria turcica.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.treatment: Rotate crops. Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.

Grape___Black_rot.symptoms: Brown lesions on leaves, often with concentric rings. Lesions may also appear on fruit, causing it to shrivel and rot.
Grape___Black_rot.causes: Caused by the fungus Guignardia bidwellii.
Grape___Black_rot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or captan. Remove and destroy infected plant parts.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).symptoms: Brown streaks or lesions in the vascular tissue of shoots. Leaves may turn yellow and drop prematurely.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).causes: Caused by a complex of fungi, including Phaeoacremonium spp. and Phaeomoniella chlamydospora.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).treatment: Prune infected parts. Apply fungicides containing propiconazole or fosetyl-aluminum.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.symptoms: Circular, tan lesions on leaves, often with a darker border. Lesions may coalesce and cause defoliation.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.causes: Caused by the fungus Isariopsis (=Alternaria) leaf spot.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.treatment: Prune infected parts. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb.

Grape___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).symptoms: Yellowing of leaves, often with mottling. Premature fruit drop and decline of tree health.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).causes: Caused by the bacterium Candidatus Liberibacter spp., transmitted by the Asian citrus psyllid.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).treatment: Manage psyllid populations. Remove and destroy infected trees.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves, often with a yellow halo. Lesions may become necrotic and cause defoliation.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.causes: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas arboricola pv. pruni.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides. Prune infected branches. Avoid overhead irrigation.

Peach___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Plants appear healthy.
